Isaiah or Isaias__37.1: And it came to pass, when king Ezechias had heard it, that he rent his garments and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the Lord.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.2: And he sent Eliacim who was over the house, and Sobna the scribe, and the ancients of the priests covered with sackcloth, to Isaias the son of Amos the prophet.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.3: And they said to him: Thus saith Ezechias: This day is a day of tribulation, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.4: It may be the Lord thy God will hear the words of Rabsaces, whom the king of the Assyrians his master hath sent to blaspheme the living God, and to reproach with words which the Lord thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that is left.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.5: And the servants of Ezechias came to Isaias.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.6: And Isaias said to them: Thus shall you say to your master: Thus saith the Lord: Be not afraid of the words that thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of the Assyrians have blasphemed me.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.7: Behold, I will send a spirit upon him, and he shall hear a message, and shall return to his own country, and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own country.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.8: And Rabsaces returned, and found the king of the Assyrians besieging Lobna. For he had heard that he was departed from Lachis.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.9: And he heard say about Tharaca the king of Ethiopia: He is come forth to fight against thee. And when he heard it, he sent messengers to Ezechias, saying:
Isaiah or Isaias__37.10: Thus shall you speak to Ezechias the king of Juda, saying: Let not thy God deceive thee, in whom thou trustest, saying: Jerusalem shall not be given into the hands of the king of the Assyrians.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.11: Behold thou hast heard all that the kings of the Assyrians hare done to all countries which they have destroyed, and canst thou be delivered?
Isaiah or Isaias__37.12: Have the gods of the nations delivered them whom my fathers have destroyed, Gozam, and Haram, and Reseph, and the children of Eden, that were in Thalassar?
Isaiah or Isaias__37.13: Where is the king of Emath, and the king of Arphad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Ana, and of Ava?
Isaiah or Isaias__37.14: And Ezechias took the letter from the hand of the messengers, and read it, and went up to the house of the Lord, and Ezechias spread it before the Lord.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.15: And Ezechias prayed to the Lord, saying:
Isaiah or Isaias__37.16: O Lord of hosts, God of Israel, who sittest upon the cherubims, thou alone art the God of all the kingdoms of the earth, thou hast made heaven and earth.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.17: Incline, O Lord, thy ear, and hear: open, O Lord, thy eyes, and see, and hear all the words of Sennacherib, which he hath sent to blaspheme the living God.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.18: For of a truth, O Lord, the kings of the Assyrians have laid waste lands, and their countries.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.19: And they have cast their gods into the fire, for they were not gods, but the works of men's hands, of wood and stone: and they broke them in pieces.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.20: And now, O Lord our God, save us out of his hand: and let all the kingdoms of the earth know, that thou only art the Lord.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.21: And Isaias the son of Amos sent to Ezechias, saying: Thus saith the Lord the God of Israel: For the prayer thou hast made to me concerning Sennacherib the king of the Assyrians:
Isaiah or Isaias__37.22: This is the word which the Lord hath spoken of him: The virgin the daughter of Sion hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn: the daughter of Jerusalem hath wagged the head after thee.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.23: Whom hast thou reproached, and whom hast thou blasphemed, and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thy eyes on high? Against the Holy One of Israel.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.24: By the hand of thy servants thou hast reproached the Lord: and hast said: With the multitude of my chariots I have gone up to the height of the mountains, to the top of Libanus: and I will out down its tall cedars, and its choice fir trees, and will enter to the top of its height, to the forest of its <u>Carmel</u>.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.25: I have digged, and drunk water, and have dried up with the sole of my foot, all the rivers shut up in banks.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.26: Hast thou not heard what I have done to him of old? from the days of old I have formed it: and now I have brought it to effect: and it hath come to pass that hills fighting together, and fenced cities should be destroyed.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.27: The inhabitants of them were weak of hand, they trembled, and were confounded: they became like the grass of the field, and the herb of the pasture, and like the grass of the housetops, which withered before it was ripe.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.28: I know thy dwelling, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.29: When thou wast mad against me, thy pride came up to my ears: therefore I will put a ring in thy nose, and a bit between thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.30: But to thee this shall be a sign: Eat this year the things that spring of themselves, and in the second year eat fruits: but in the third year sow and reap, and giant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.31: And that which shall be saved of the house of Juda, and which is left, shall take root downward, and shall bear fruit upward:
Isaiah or Isaias__37.32: For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a, remnant, and salvation from mount Sion: the zeal of the Lord of hosts shall do this.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.33: Wherefore thus saith the Lord concerning the king of the Assyrians: He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow into it, nor come before it with shield, nor cast a trench about it.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.34: By the way that he came, he shall return, and into this city he shall not come, saith the Lord.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.35: And I will protect this city, and will save it for my own sake, and for the sake of David my servant.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.36: And the angel of the Lord went out, and slew in the camp of the Assyrians a hundred and eighty-five thousand. And they arose in the morning, and behold they were all dead corpses.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.37: And Sennacherib the king of the Assyrians went out and departed, and returned, and dwelt in Ninive.
Isaiah or Isaias__37.38: And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the temple of Nesroch his god, that Adramelech and Sarasar his sons slew him with the sword: and they fled into the land of Ararat, and Asarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.
